snippet: Though three-quarters of its users are outside the United States, only a modest portion of its ad revenue is generated there. But it’s growing fast.
abstract: Twitter is still trying to figure out how to generate revenue from users abroad, even as international consumers now represent more than three-quarters of 232 million people who use service; currently, only  modest portion of Twitter's ad revenue is generated outside United States, but numbers are growing fast.

byline.contributor: Vindu Goel contributed reporting from San Francisco.

lead_paragraph: Though three-quarters of its users are outside the United States, only a modest portion of its ad revenue is generated there. But it’s growing fast.

headline.main: Ads Scant When Twitter Crosses Borders
headline.print_headline: Ads Scant When Twitter Crosses Borders
